contentrichtext.text: {{chinese-name|[[Yao (surname)|Yeo]]}} '''Yeo Cheow Tong''' ({{zh|s=姚照东|p=Yáo Zhàodōng|poj=Iâu Chiàu-tong}}; born 22 June 1947) is a former [[politician]] from [[Singapore]]. A member of the governing [[People's Action Party]] (PAP), he served in the [[Cabinet of Singapore|Cabinet]] from 1990 to 2006, and was a [[Parliament of Singapore|Member of Parliament]] (MP) from 1984 to 2011. ==Career== He worked for Singapore's [[Economic Development Board]] (EDB) from 1972–75, before entering the private sector. He entered politics in 1984. ===Political career=== At the [[Singaporean general election, 1984|1984 general election]], Yeo was elected a Member of Parliament for Hong Kah constituency. In 1985, he was appointed a Minister of State at the [[Ministry of Health (Singapore)|Ministry of Health]] and [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Singapore)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs]]. In 1988, Yeo became the Acting [[Ministry of Health (Singapore)|Minister for Health]], before becoming a full member of the Cabinet in 1990. He went on to hold a number of different Cabinet positions including [[Ministry of Community Development, Youth and Sports|Minister for Community Development]] (1991–94), [[Ministry of Trade and Industry (Singapore)|Minister for Trade and Industry]] (1994–97), [[Ministry of the Environment and Water Resources|Minister for the Environment]] (1997–99), [[Ministry of Information, Communications and the Arts|Minister for Communications and Information Technology]] (1999–2001), and [[Ministry of Transport (Singapore)|Minister for Transport]] (2001–06). In June 2006, Yeo resigned from the Cabinet to return to the private sector. He continued to serve as a Member of Parliament for the [[Hong Kah Group Representation Constituency]] until 2011, when he retired from politics. ==Education== Yeo was educated at [[Anglo-Chinese School]], before receiving a [[Colombo Plan]] Scholarship in 1967 to study at the [[University of Western Australia]], where he received a [[Bachelor of Engineering| Bachelor of Engineering (Mechanical)]] degree. ==Personal life== Yeo is married to lawyer Helen Yeo-Tan Cheng Hoong.
